revision.text:
<!-- This article is a part of [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Aircraft]]. Please see [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Aircraft/page content]] for recommended layout. --> {|{{Infobox Aircraft Begin |name = Hürkuş |image = File:TAI Hürkuş.jpg |caption = }}{{Infobox Aircraft Type |type = [[Trainer (aircraft)|basic trainer]] and [[ground attack aircraft]] |national origin= [[Turkey]] |manufacturer = [[Turkish Aerospace Industries]] |designer = |first flight = 29 August 2013<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=http://www.aa.com.tr/tr/manset/221409--hurkus-ilk-ucusunu-gerceklestirdi |title=HÜRKUŞ ilk uçuşunu gerçekleştirdi – Anadolu Ajansı |publisher=Aa.com.tr |date= |accessdate=2013-08-29}}</ref> |introduced = |retired = |number built = 4 prototypes |status = In production (2016)<ref>{{cite web|title=Deal signed for serial production of Turkish airplane Hürkuş|url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/deal-signed-for-serial-production-of-turkish-airplane-hurkus-.aspx?pageID=238&nID=60197&NewsCatID=345|website=Hurriyet Daily News|accessdate=13 September 2016}}</ref> |unit cost = |primary user = |developed from = |variants with their own articles = }} |}
The '''TAI Hürkuş''' ''(Free Bird)''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/turkey-grounds-t-37-fleet-for-safety-checks-367952/ |title=Turkey grounds T-37 fleet for safety checks |publisher=Flightglobal.com |date=2012-02-08 |accessdate=2013-01-25}}</ref> is a [[tandem]] two-seat, low-wing, single-engine, [[turboprop]] aircraft being developed by [[Turkish Aerospace Industries]] (TAI) as a new [[Trainer (aircraft)|basic trainer]] and [[ground attack aircraft]] for the [[Turkish Armed Forces]].<ref name="İşte Hürkuş">{{cite web|url = http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/gundem/14221260.asp|title = İşte Hürkuş|accessdate = 22 August 2010|last = Hürriyet – Doğan Yayın Holding|authorlink = |year = 2010}}</ref><ref name="TAIparis">{{cite web|url=http://www.tai.com.tr/news.aspx?contentDefID=63 |title=TAI'S Turkish Primary and Basic Trainer Aircraft(Hurkis) To be Displayed at 47th Paris Airshow |accessdate=22 August 2010 |last=[[Turkish Aerospace Industries]] |authorlink= |year=2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722123743/http://www.tai.com.tr/news.aspx?contentDefID=63 |archivedate=July 22, 2011 }}</ref><ref name="Undersecretaries ">{{cite web|url = http://www.ssm.gov.tr/home/projects/air/Aircraft/Sayfalar/HURKUS.aspx|title = Turkish Primary and Basic Trainer Aircraft (HÜRKUŞ) Development Program|accessdate = 22 August 2010|last = Undersecretariat for Defense Industries|authorlink = |date=February 2010}}</ref>
The aircraft is named after [[Vecihi Hürkuş]], a [[World War I]] and [[Turkish Independence War]] veteran pilot, a Turkish aviation pioneer and the first Turkish airplane manufacturer.<ref name="OriginOfName">{{cite web|url=http://www.tai.com.tr/press.aspx?contentDefID=35 |title=Aviation Week – Show News – Turkey's New Trainer Gets Old Name: Hurkis |accessdate=22 August 2010 |last=[[Turkish Aerospace Industries]] |authorlink= |date=June 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722124028/http://www.tai.com.tr/press.aspx?contentDefID=35 |archivedate=July 22, 2011 }}</ref>
==Design and development== The TAI Hürkuş Development Program started with an agreement signed between Turkish Undersecretariat for Defense Industries (Savunma Sanayii Müsteşarlığı (SSM)) and TAI in March 2006. Under the agreement the company will design, manufacture and complete the civil certification the aircraft to [[European Aviation Safety Agency]] CS 23 standards.<ref name="TAIProg">{{cite web|url=http://www.tai.com.tr/prog.aspx?contentDefID=6 |title=Turkish Primary and Basic Trainer Aircraft – Hurkis |accessdate=22 August 2010 |last=[[Turkish Aerospace Industries]] |authorlink= |year=2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091228060742/http://www.tai.com.tr/prog.aspx?contentDefID=6 |archivedate=December 28, 2009 }}</ref>
By June 2012 the Hürkuş program had consumed one million man-hours with the work of 140 engineers. About a quarter of the Turkish engineers who have worked on Hürkuş are female, as well as two of the three project heads.<ref name="youtube1">{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6wyKmAnVTLo&feature=player_embedded#! |title=Hürkuş'un kadın mühendisleri |publisher=YouTube |date=2012-07-15 |accessdate=2013-01-25}}</ref><ref name="milliyet1">{{cite web|url=http://ekonomi.milliyet.com.tr/ilk-yerli-ucak-hurkus-1-milyon-saatte-tasarlandi/ekonomi/ekonomidetay/27.06.2012/1559652/default.htm |title=Milliyet – İlk yerli uçak Hürkuş 1 milyon saatte tasarlandı |publisher=Ekonomi.milliyet.com.tr |date=2012-06-27 |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://kokpit.aero/H%C3%BCrku%C5%9Fun%20kad%C4%B1n%20m%C3%BChendisleri?filter_name=h%C3%BCrku%C5%9F |title=Hürkuş'un kadın mühendisleri |publisher=Kokpit.aero |date= |accessdate=2013-01-25}}</ref>
The Hürkuş will be equipped for day and night flying as well as basic pilot training, instrument flying, navigation training, weapons and formation training. The aircraft will have good visibility from both cockpits with a 50 degree down-view angle from the rear cockpit, [[cabin pressurization]] (nominal 4.16 psid), [[Martin-Baker]] Mk T-16 N 0/0 [[ejection seat]]s, an onboard oxygen generation system (OBOGS), an Environmental Control System (Vapor Cycle Cooling), an anti-G system, high shock absorbing [[landing gear]] for training missions, and Hands On Throttle and Stick (HOTAS).<ref name="TAIparis" /><ref name="TAIProg" /> [[Microtecnica]] of [[Turin, Italy]] has been selected to provide the aircraft's environmental control system.<ref name="FlightGlobal040610">{{cite web|url = http://www.flightglobal.com/articles/2010/06/04/342815/microtecnica-selected-to-equip-turkeys-hurkus-trainer.html|title = Microtecnica selected to equip Turkey's Hurkus trainer|accessdate = 22 August 2010|last = Hoyle|first = Craig|authorlink = |date=June 2010}}</ref> The Hürkuş has been designed for a 35-year [[service life]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=tS-kl61663s |title=Türkiye'nin uçağı Hürkuş |publisher=YouTube |date= |accessdate=2013-01-25}}</ref>
The Hürkuş development program has been subject to delays. In 2007 it was forecast that the first prototype would fly in late-2009 with first delivery, upon completion of the certification process, forecast for 2011. On 27 June 2012, the Hürkuş was officially rolled out at a ceremony held at TAI's Kazan premises. The forecast date for the first flight was then delayed until later in 2012<ref name="TAIparis" /> and actually occurred on 29 August 2013 when the aircraft flew from the Ankara Akıncı Air Base on a 33-minute flight.<ref name="autogenerated1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tai.com.tr/en/basin-bultenleri/turkish-primary-and-basic-trainer-hurkus-was-rolled-out |title=Turkish Primary and Basic Trainer "Hürkuş" Rolls Out – Turkish Aerospace Industries, Inc |publisher=Tai.com.tr |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zaman.com.tr/gundem_hurkus-ilk-ucusunu-yapti_2126251.html |title=HÜRKUŞ, ilk uçuşunu yaptı |publisher=ZAMAN |date= |accessdate=2013-08-29}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Niles |first=Russ |url=http://www.avweb.com/avwebflash/news/Turkish-Hurkus-Military-Trainer-Flies220521-1.html |title=Turkish Hurkus Military Trainer Flies – AVweb flash Article |publisher=Avweb |date=2013-08-29 |accessdate=2013-09-02}}</ref>
The Turkish government has indicated that the aircraft is expected to attract export sales, possibly from Middle Eastern countries, African countries or countries with limited air force budgets.<ref name="TAIparis" /><ref name="Undersecretaries " /><ref name="milliyet1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://kokpit.aero/index.php?route=image/image_gallery&image_gallery_id=42&page=9 |title=Hürkuş'un farklı detayları |publisher=Kokpit.aero |date= |accessdate=2013-01-25}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/tai-hurkus-nears-first-flight-and-orders-385663/ |title=TAI Hurkus nears first flight and orders |publisher=Flightglobal.com |date=2013-05-13 |accessdate=2013-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.airrecognition.com/index.php/archive-world-worldwide-news-air-force-aviation-aerospace-air-military-defence-industry/2014-global-news-worldwide-world-international-air-force-aviation/january-2014-global-news-worldwide-world-international-air-force-aviation-aerospace-air-defence-/971-turkey-to-open-contract-negotiations-with-tai-for-the-serial-production-of-the-huerkus-trainer-aircraft.html |title=Turkey to open contract negotiations with TAI for the serial production of the Hürkus Trainer Aircraft |date=January 4, 2014}}</ref> According to a news report from [[CNN Türk]], [[Australia]] and [[Sweden]] are interested in the aircraft.<ref name="youtube1"/>
==Variants== ;Hürkuş-A :Basic version which has been certified with EASA according to CS-23 requirements. It is intended for the civilian market <ref name="flightglobal1">{{cite web|url=http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/picture-tai-rolls-out-turkeys-first-hurkus-trainer-373621/|title=PICTURE: TAI rolls out Turkey's first Hurkus trainer|date=2 July 2012|work=flightglobal.com|accessdate=14 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tai.com.tr/en/basin-bultenleri/easa-awards-tai-with-design-organization-certificate |title=EASA Awards TAI with Design Organization Certificate – Turkish Aerospace Industries, Inc |publisher=Tai.com.tr |date= |accessdate=2013-01-25}}</ref> ;Hürkuş-B :Advanced version with integrated avionics (including HUD, MFDs, and Mission Computer).<ref name="Specs">{{cite web|url=https://www.tai.com.tr/en/project/hurkus |title=HURKUS – Turkish Aerospace Industries, Inc |publisher=Tai.com.tr |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref> Cockpit avionics layout is similar to F-16 and F-35 fighters.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kokpit.aero/index.php?route=image/image_gallery&image_gallery_id=42&page=5 |title=Hürkuş'un farklı detayları |publisher=Kokpit.aero |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref> The [[Turkish Army]] is considering an order for 15 aircraft.<ref name="flightglobal1"/> ;Hürkuş-C :An armed version for the close air support role will have a maximum weapons load of 3,300lb (1,500kg) and also carry a forward-looking infrared (FLIR) sensor. As the Hürkuş will be capable of operating from unprepared runways, it could also attract export orders, TAI believes. The Turkish Army has expressed interest in the Hürkuş C to provide support for its attack helicopters.<ref name="flightglobal1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://kokpit.aero/hurkus-siparis-bekliyor |title=Hürkuş siparişi SSİK toplantısında gündeme geliyor |publisher=Kokpit.aero |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://kokpit.aero/index.php?route=image/image_gallery&image_gallery_id=42&page=9 |title=Hürkuş'un farklı detayları |publisher=Kokpit.aero |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref> ;Coast Guard version :TAI plans to offer another version of the Hürkuş to support the [[Turkish Coast Guard]]'s maritime patrol operations. The aircraft's rear seat would be occupied by an operator for a FLIR sensor using an [[ASELSAN]] [[FLIR]] system.<ref name="flightglobal1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://kokpit.aero/index.php?route=image/image_gallery&image_gallery_id=42&page=10 |title=Hürkuş'un farklı detayları |publisher=Kokpit.aero |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref>
==Specifications (Hürkuş)== {{Aircraft specs |ref=TAI and Airforce Technology<ref name="Specs" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.airforce-technology.com/projects/taihurkus/|title=TAI Hurkus Basic Trainer Aircraft|work=airforce-technology.com|accessdate=14 August 2016}}</ref> |prime units?=met<!-- imp or kts first for US aircraft, and UK aircraft pre-metrification, met(ric) first for all others. You MUST choose a format, or no specifications will show --> <!-- General characteristics --> |genhide=

|prop blade number=5<!-- propeller aircraft --> |prop name=[[Hartzell Propeller]] HC-B5MA-3 |prop dia m=<!-- propeller aircraft --> |prop dia ft=<!-- propeller aircraft --> |prop dia in=<!-- propeller aircraft --> |prop dia note=
<!-- Performance --> |perfhide=

|more performance= <!-- Armament --> |armahide=
|guns= 12.7mm and 20mm pods |bombs= [[Mark 81 bomb|Mk-81]], [[Mk-82]], [[HGK (bomb)|Tübitak SAGE HGK-3 (82)]], Tübitak SAGE KGK-82, BDU33 and MK106 training ordnance |rockets= [[Roketsan Cirit]], 2.75-inch rockets |missiles= [[UMTAS|Roketsan UMTAS]] |hardpoints= |hardpoint capacity= |hardpoint rockets= |hardpoint missiles= |hardpoint bombs= |hardpoint other= {{convert|70|u.s.gal}} external fuel tank |avionics= *[[Air data computer]] *[[Attitude and heading reference system]] *[[Emergency locator transmitter]] *[[GPS]] *[[Transponder (aviation)|Mode S transponder]] *[[Radar altimeter]] }}
